DataElement.preferredName: Six-Item Cognitive Impairment Test Score Greater Than 3 Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether the Six-Item Cognitive Impairment Test (6CIT) score is greater than 3.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Six-Item Cognitive Impairment Test Greater Than Three Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: : A brief cognitive function test. It contains a logical memory item, two attention items, and three orientation questions. It takes less than five minutes to administer and is widely used in primary care settings.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status._A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: : A brief cognitive function test. It contains a logical memory item, two attention items, and three orientation questions. It takes less than five minutes to administer and is widely used in primary care settings.

Concepts.definition: A brief cognitive function test. It contains a logical memory item, two attention items, and three orientation questions. It takes less than five minutes to administer and is widely used in primary care settings.

Property.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status._A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
